Author: inclementdab
Content:
For those doing REST calls in the future and want a **CUSTOM HEADER**

When calling `SetHeader` it is possible to escape the original Content-Type string that is padded to the object and essentially trick libcurl in the engine. Dont ask how we figured this out, its ugly. Either way, start your header with `\r\n` and then follow it with your custom header entry. Between each custom header, add `\r\n` once more to break them up. Finally at the end it is nessecary to add `Content-Type: application/json` since it is no longer automatically set by the SetHeader function. Without these steps you will get a 400 error. Enjoy your header based api keys üòâ
